blocks.title: How Germans remember the World Wars

synopses.short: Remembrance Day: How Germans remember the World Wars
synopses.long: Can people in today's Germany mourn their dead without whitewashing their country's past? We ask three Germans, ahead of the 100th anniversary of the end of World War One.
synopses.medium: Can people in today's Germany mourn their dead without whitewashing their country's past?

blocks.caption: Clip, Video, UK-only, guidance, no subtitles. But AV captions can't be multi-paragraph or have rich formatting.

blocks.title: 'I lost my leg to type 2 diabetes' (NON UK)

synopses.short: Diabetes type 2: 'I blame myself for the loss of my leg'
synopses.long: Every week 170 people in the UK lose a limb because of diabetes. Around four million people in the UK are living with diabetes - and around 90% of them have type 2 diabetes, which is often linked to being overweight or inactive. Diabetes prescriptions are costing the NHS in England more than £1 billion a year, according to figures from NHS Digital. And a further 12 million people could be at risk of getting type 2 diabetes in the future. Stephen Richardson has told the BBC he blames himself for the loss of his limb.
synopses.medium: Stephen Richardson admits he ignored advice about diet and exercise.

headlines.shortHeadline: Zika en Panamá
headlines.headline: Hallan zika en el cordón umbilical de un recién nacido en Panamá

promo.summary: Panamá registró este sábado el primer caso de microcefalia posiblemente relacionada con el virus zika, según confirmó el Ministerio de Salud de ese país.

indexImage.caption: Se sabe con certeza que el mosquito Aedes aegypti es la vía principal de transmisión del virus zika, que está presente en al menos 24 países y territorios en América.
